column4: I'm trying to connect to an NFS share I set up on another computer in my network, but the connection always times out, both comps are running 12.04, can someone help me figure this out?
are NFS ports open or is the firewall inactive?
first try getting your setup running with no firewall (iptables -F)
hm, I don't see any ports being forwarded on my router RE NFS, how can I check if the NFS is actually running on the server?
netstat -nltp should show portmap and some rpc process. though there is a better way which i forgot
osiris I'll try both in a minute
actually, I just noticed transmission's port doesn't seem to be automatically forwarding either, which seems rather strange
ok, I found that NFS shows up in rpcinfo, and it listed the port for it as well, but I was wondering whether or not NFS uses upnp or not?
so I have to add the rule to my router myself?
yes, and some NFS ports are random (there is a way to make them static though).
for simple file sharing, sshfs works without all this mess.
I kinda need it to be gui though
sshfs mount points can be opened in GUI explorers, is that what you are talking about?
does sshfs require login using the machines UID and pass though?
ssh requires running sshd on the server and on client it involves giving credentials to mount a folder.
